extractions.description: The paper introduces Logit-scaling GFlowNets (Logit-GFN), a new architectural design aimed at improving the training efficiency and stability of temperature-conditional GFlowNets. The method reduces the numerical challenges arising from different gradient profiles at various temperatures by using a learned function of temperature to scale the logits of the policy directly. Empirical results show enhanced generalization and mode discovery in various biological and chemical tasks using this approach.

title.value: Learning to Scale Logits for Temperature-Conditional GFlowNets

research_field.justification: The paper focuses on architectures and methods related to the training of deep learning models, specifically generative flow networks.
research_field.quote: GFlowNets are probabilistic models that sequentially generate compositional structures through a stochastic policy.

sub_research_field.justification: The focus is on generative flow networks (GFlowNets), which are a type of deep generative model.
sub_research_field.quote: Generative flow networks (GFlowNets) constitute a class of deep generative models and a reinforcement learning (RL) methodology designed to sample compositional objects.

name.justification: This is the novel architectural design proposed by the authors in the paper.
name.quote: We propose Logit-scaling GFlowNets (Logit-GFN), a novel architectural design that greatly accelerates the training of temperature-conditional GFlowNets.

name.quote: All of our GFlowNet models incorporate the parametrization mapping of relative edge flow policy (SSR), as originally proposed by (Shen et al., 2023). When dealing with pairs of states (s, sâ€²), we encode each state into a one-hot encoding vector and concatenate them as input for the forward and backward policy networks.
